org.tinfour.demo.utils

Class TestPalette

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinfour.demo.utils.TestPalette

  • public class TestPalette
extends Object
    Provides definitions and operations for assigning color values to data.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TestPalette()
      Default constructor using the blue to yellow palette.
      TestPalette(String name, float[][] rgb)
      Construct a palette colorizer using the palette specified as an array of red/green/blue values in the range 0 to 255.

      • TestPalette

        public TestPalette(String name,
                   float[][] rgb)
        Construct a palette colorizer using the palette specified as an array of red/green/blue values in the range 0 to 255.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the palette (null if not used)
        rgb - an n by 3 array of rgb values.

      • TestPalette

        public TestPalette()
        Default constructor using the blue to yellow palette.

    • Method Detail

      • getBlueToYellowPalette

        public static TestPalette getBlueToYellowPalette()
        Gets an instance of the palette colorizer using the blue-to-yellow palette. The palette used is based on the CIE LCH model which tends to give better color transitions for the blue-to-yellow range than the simpler RGB model.
        Returns:
        a valid instance.

      • getDefaultPalette

        public static TestPalette getDefaultPalette()
        Gets an instance of the palette colorizer using the default palette. The choice of palette for this routine is undefined and subject to change.
        Returns:
        a valid instance.

      • getPurpleTonesPalette

        public static TestPalette getPurpleTonesPalette()
        Gets an instance of the palette colorizer using the purple-tones palette. The palette used is based on the CIE LCH model which tends to give better color transitions for the blue-to-yellow range than the simpler RGB model.
        Returns:
        a valid instance.

      • getRedToYellowToWhitePalette

        public static TestPalette getRedToYellowToWhitePalette()
        Constructs an instance of the palette colorizer using the red-to-yellow-to-white palette.
        Returns:
        a valid instance.

        Returns:

        public static TestPalette getLinearGrayPalette()
        Constructs an instance of the palette colorizer using the a linear interpolation of values in the RGB color space.
        Returns:
        a valid instance.

      • getARGB

        public int getARGB(double z,
                   double zMin,
                   double zMax)
        Assigns a color value in the ARGB system to a z value based on its position within a range of values and the palette associated with this instance.

        The alpha channel value (high-order byte) for the return is always set to fully opaque for valid inputs. If given a undefined input value (Double.NaN), a zero (fully transparent) value will be returned. If given a z value outside the specified region, its value will be constrained as necessary.

        Parameters:
        z - the z value of interest
        zMin - the value associated with the minimum-index color in the palette.
        zMax - the value associated with the maximum-index color in the palette.
        Returns:
        an integer in the ARGB format

      • getColor

        public Color getColor(double z,
                      double zMin,
                      double zMax)
        Assigns a Color object to a z value based on its position within a range of values and the palette associated with this instance.

        The alpha channel value (high-order byte) for the return is always set to fully opaque for valid inputs. If given a undefined input value (Double.NaN), a zero (fully transparent) value will be returned. If given a z value outside the specified region, its value will be constrained as necessary.

        Parameters:
        z - the z value of interest
        zMin - the value associated with the minimum-index color in the palette.
        zMax - the value associated with the maximum-index color in the palette.
        Returns:
        an integer in the ARGB format

      • getPaletteByName

        public static TestPalette getPaletteByName(String paletteName)
        Gets the palette specified by name
        Parameters:
        paletteName - a valid string matching one a named palette defined by this class.
        Returns:
        if found, a valid palette; otherwise, a null
